pros: VIU has a very generous leave policy and a good 401(k) plan (and is striving to increase their benefits package and provide other perks for their employees in the future).  Compensation is in line with other universities.  Several recent organizational changes have provided a more experienced leadership group, and a lot of the employees who were unhappy and/or not particularly skilled at their jobs have left the company.  The overall skills and accountability at the University have increased because of the positive changes being made.  There is more focus on the employees and on getting the right people to fill positions.  The quality of employees from both the staff and faculty side has improved.
cons: Change is a process with growing pains.  There are the occasional hiccups involved with change management, but the changes are, in the end, positive ones.  The current benefits package is not particularly family-friendly, but I've been told that plans are underway to change that with the next plan year.
